name: PurchaseReceiptBasic_GetAllReceiptBasic
description:
Get a range with purchase receipts, ScreenId=PO302000
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is 500

numberToRead.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

skipRecords.description: This field has been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use pagenumber and pagesize for pagination purposes. Pagenumber and pagesize does not work with NumberToRead and SkipRecords.

lastModifiedDateTime.description:
This value, generated by the system, indicates the last time the record was modified. Use it to retrieve all records that have been modified since that time, up to the present.

Accepted format:
* ```yyyy-MM-dd```
* ```yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss```
* ```yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.FFF```
* ```yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss```
* ```yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.FFF```

_Note:_ __LastModifiedDateTime__ and __LastModifiedDateTimeCondition__ are __mutually inclusive__.

lastModifiedDateTimeCondition.description:
This value represents the condition to be applied when retrieving records.

Accepted values (without the single quotes):
* '>' for greater than
* '<' for less than
* '>=' for greater than or equal
* '<=' for less than or equal

_Note:_ __LastModifiedDateTime__ and __LastModifiedDateTimeCondition__ are __mutually inclusive__.

pageSize.description:
Pagination parameter. Number of items to be collected.
Please use a page size lower or equal to the allowed max page size which is returned as part of the metadata information.
If requested page size is greater than allowed max page size, request will be limited to max page size.

erp-api-background.description: If a URL value is provided, then API endpoint will be queued and executed in background. When the execution of the background operation is finished, the system will POST the response to the specified URL. The endpoint itself responds in this case with a 202-Accepted status and a reference to a state document for the background operation.

$block: This class represents a Purchase Receipt in PurchaseReceiptController. Used for getting data.

$ul: **branchNumber**: Mandatory field: Document details tab > Branch* > The branch to which the document belongs.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**: Click the magnifier. > The identifier.
**controlQty**: The top part > Control qty. > The total quantity of goods on the receipt or return
**controlTotal**: The top part > Control amt. > The total amount of the receipt or return, which you manually enter.
**createBill**: The top part > Create invoice > A check box that you select if the system must create an appropriate invoice (or adjustment) automatically when the purchase receipt is released.
**currency**: The top part > Currency > The currency the supplier uses for invoicing.
**date**: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* > The date when the receipt document was created.
**errorInfo**
**exchangeRate**
**hold**: The top part > Hold > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document has the On hold status.
**lastModifiedDateTime**: System generated information.
**lines**: Document details tab > Line no > The number of the purchase receipt line on the document.
**location**: Mandatory field: The top part Location* > The supplier location from which the items should be received or to which they should be returned.
**countryId**: Location*.
**id**: Click the magnifier > The identifier
**name**: Click the magnifier > The displayed name
**metadata**
**maxPageSize**
**totalCount**
**postPeriod**: Mandatory field: The top part > Post period* > The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format MMYYYY.
**receiptNbr**: The top part > Receipt no. > The unique reference number of the purchase receipt.
**receiptType**: The top part > Type > The type of the document, which can be one of the following options: Receipt, Return, Transfer receipt.
**status**: The top part > Status > The current status of the purchase or transfer receipt, or return, which the system assigns automatically. On hold, Balanced, Released.
**supplier**: Mandatory field: The top part > Supplier* > The supplier from which the items have been received or to which they will be returned.
**internalId**
**name**: The name of the particular destination of the selected type.
**number**: The identifier of the particular destination of the selected type.
**supplierRef**: The top part > Supplier ref. > The reference number of the supplier document this receipt or return is based on.
**totalAmt**: The top part > Total amt. > The total amount calculated for items received from or returned to the supplier.
**totalQty**: The top part > Total qty. > The total quantity of items received from or returned to the supplier.
**vatExemptTotal**: The top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT.
**vatTaxableTotal**: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subjected to VAT.
**warehouse**: Mandatory field: The top part or the Documents details tab > Warehouse* > The warehouse from which the items have been received for transfer orders.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**stateLocation**
